info.author: Hartmut Goebel
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
The library is designed to supports both writing macros (called by OOo) and
interacting with OOo from an external Python programm (using the UNO bridge).

The "UNO bridge" side is meant to implement a more Pythonic and high-level
interface than Danny Bewers OOoLib. While the "Makro" side is meant to support
writing macros. Well, there will be a big intersection between these parts :-)

Sample scripts include
- a simple OpenOffice-Server
- odf2pdf to convert ODF-Files to PDF
info.name: openoffice-python
info.summary: Python libraries for interacting with OpenOffice.org
info.html_description:
The library is designed to supports both writing macros (called by OOo) and interacting with OOo from an external Python programm (using the UNO bridge).

The “UNO bridge” side is meant to implement a more Pythonic and high-level interface than Danny Bewers OOoLib. While the “Makro” side is meant to support writing macros. Well, there will be a big intersection between these parts :-)

Sample scripts include - a simple OpenOffice-Server - odf2pdf to convert ODF-Files to PDF
